title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.20 | 06-06-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: This talk was more attractive than the hymns of the Vedas.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse describing the ladies of Hastinapura discussing Krishna's transcendental qualities, which was more attractive than Vedic hymns.

themes: Krishna as the goal of the Vedas
segments.key_quote: In all the Vedic literatures, the goal is the personality of Godhead, Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the Vedas, Ramayana, Mahabharata, and Puranas glorify Hari, and the Bhagavatam exclusively glorifies Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Devotee is always absorbed in thought of Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that devotees are always absorbed in thoughts of Krishna, and their discussions revolve around Krishna.

segments.key_quote: The language is immaterial, but the subject matter is important.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that anything sung in praise of the Lord is Shruti Mantra, and the subject matter is more important than the language, citing examples of Narottam Dasa Thakur and Purandara Dasa.

segments.key_quote: By absorbing their mind in thoughts and actions of the Supreme Lord, they develop the consciousness of Vedic wisdom by the grace of the Supreme Lord Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that by absorbing their minds in Krishna, the ladies develop Vedic wisdom through Krishna's grace, and Krishna enlightens devotees from within.

segments.key_quote: The discussions or the descriptions in the Puranas, Itihasas, about the personal feature of the Lord are more attractive and pleasing to hear than the descriptions in the Upanishads.
segments.summary: The speaker explains why the ladies' talks were more attractive than Vedic hymns, because the Puranas describe the personal feature of the Lord in detail, which is more attractive than the impersonal descriptions in the Upanishads.
